article.title: Links
article.para: This page lists recommended web sites listed by category.

section.title: XML Design Patterns
section.para: Links to pages dealing specifically with XML Design Patterns.

varlistentry.term: Design Patterns in XML Music Representation

listitem.para: An excellent paper discussing how XML Design Patterns (many taken from this site) can be useful in creating an XML DTD.

varlistentry.term: Design Patterns in XML Applications: Part 1

listitem.para: Fabio Arciniegas' article on using object oriented design patterns in processing XML documents. Discusses four patterns: Command, Flyweight, Wrapper, and Iterator.

varlistentry.term: Design Patterns in XML Applications: Part 2

listitem.para: Fabio Arciniegas' article on XML structural patterns. Includes six patterns.
Ian Graham and Liam Quin’s site which contains 4 patterns, Running Text, Generated Text, Footnote, and Text Blocks.

varlistentry.term: Architectural Design Patterns for XML Documents

listitem.para: Kyle Downey’s article attempts to document a few whole-document design patterns.
A XML processing design pattern.
A paper describing four XML processing design pattern.
An article on XML.com describing three structural patterns for XML Schema: Composite, Abstract Model, and Peer Specialization.

section.title: Other Patterns
section.para: Links to pages about patterns in area other than XML.

listitem.para: A pattern repository focusing on patterns that can be used with Java middleware technologies. They are inviting site visitors to contribute patterns.
A pattern repository for patterns to be used in hypermedia design. The patterns are categorized into Interface/Layout, Structure/Navigation and Content Oriented Patterns.

varlistentry.term: Patterns and Software: Essential Concepts and Terminology

listitem.para: Brad Appleton’s excellent page about patterns in the field of object-oriented software.

section.title: XML Design
section.para: Links to pages about XML structural design issues.

varlistentry.term: Serializing Graphs of Data in XML

listitem.para: A discussion of representing graph structure such as RDBMS tables in XML.
Robin Cover’s page covering the element vs. attributes debate. When should you use an element? When should you use an attribute? Check this page for some good references.

section.title: Schema Repositories
section.para: Links to pages that contain repositories of XML Schemas. Great place to look for schemas to reuse, or to get ideas from.

listitem.para: Oasis’ catalog of XML specifications.

varlistentry.term: Robin Cover’s Listing of XML Applications

listitem.para: A comprehensive listing of XML applications and announced industry initiatives.
A catalog of many different schemas from a variety of categories.

article.title: Other XML Links
article.para: This page lists recommended web sites listed by category.

section.title: General XML
section.para: Links to pages about general XML information.

listitem.para: The official XML 1.0 Recommendation from the W3C site.
A good general XML site with article and lots of reference pages.
A site that provide daily news stories about all aspects of XML.
Robin Cover provides extensive references that cover the entire SGML/XML world, updated continually.

section.title: XSLT
section.para: Links to pages about XSLT, the Extensible Stylesheet Language: Transformations.

listitem.para: The official XSLT 1.0 Recommendation from the W3C site.
A good site with lots of general information about XSLT.
Contains frequently asked questions from the XSL-List mailing list. Maintained by Dave Pawson.
